trial_identification.studytitle: Educational Intervention for Older People with Asthma
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Educational program for older people with asthma to improve asthma control

interventions.interventions: Educational intervention to address the concerns of older people with asthma. One hour educational session after baseline measurement. 3 month and 12 month follow up adn outcome measurement
interventions.comparator: Brochure only education compared with comprehensive hands on educational program addressing specific concerns and device technique

primaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement in Asthma Control: Measured by Asthma Control Questionnaire, reduced number of asthma exacerbations, improvement in breathing by reduction in B2 agonist use and improved Lung function
Improved Medication adherence: Measured by Adherence Questionnaire and tracking device monitoring of preventer

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Improvement in Quality of life: Measured by Asthma Related Quality of Life Questionnaire

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Age >55 years with doctor diagnosed asthma and currently using preventer therapy
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Fixed airflow obstruction post bronchodilator Fev1/FVC <70% predicted Smoking history plus 10 pack years

trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation by using a randomization table created by a computer software

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Asthma control of older people can be positively influenced by education addressing the major issues of: asthma beliefs at onset, treatment side effects, explanation of asthma diagnosis and device use education.
